abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings convey a satisfactory project
            outcome, highly likely sustainability, and high
            institutional development impacts. The first lesson suggests
            that building human resource and research capacity is a
            long-term endeavor that requires concerted public efforts.
            The Scientific and Technological (S&T) capacity building
            strategy has been reinforced by  the National Council for
            Science and Technology (CONACYT) co-funding of scholarships
            and research grants with state governments (Mixed Funds) and
            line ministries (Sectoral Funds). This is an example to be
            considered by other countries, as a way to leverage the use
            of public resources, increase policy coherence, and maximize
            development impact. Following lessons indicate that
            effective support programs for private sector technology
            development, require adequate time for demand to be properly
            articulated. And, related  programs should also allow
            resources help finance the formulation of new technological
            projects due to private sector weaknesses in technological
            areas. Related to the above, the importance of dissemination
            activities cannot be underestimated. The successful
            implementation of new S&T programs requires
            well-designed dissemination programs that are able to reach
            targeted beneficiaries. Lessons further reinforce that
            Project design should be simple and flexible to facilitate
            implementation and allow the project to adapt to changing
            conditions and emerging opportunities, and as well, Project
            design needs to define clear performance indicators which
            are closely connected to project objectives and interventions.
